abstract_summ: While most patients experience only mild symptoms, a relevant proportion develop severe disease progression with increasing hypoxia up to acute respiratory distress syndrome.Results found that patients with higher NT-proBNP (above 88.64 pg/mL) level had more risks of in-hospital death.After adjusting for potential cofounders in separate modes, NT-proBNP presented as an independent risk factor of in-hospital death in patients with severe COVID-19.The pandemic Coronavirus-disease 19 (COVID-19) is characterized by a heterogeneous clinical course.CONCLUSION: NT-proBNP might be an independent risk factor for in-hospital death in patients with severe COVID-19.In addition, COVID‐19 patients with bilateral lung involvement or multiple lobes involvement should be taken seriously and actively treated to prevent deterioration of the disease.
title_summ: Prognostic value of NT-proBNP in patients with severe COVID-19Level of IL-6 predicts respiratory failure in hospitalized symptomatic COVID-19 patientsEarly risk factors of the exacerbation of Coronavirus disease 2019 pneumoniaPrognostic value of NT-proBNP in patients with severe COVID-19Troponin I, a risk factor indicating more severe pneumonia among patients with novel coronavirus infected pneumonia
title_abstract_phrases: While most patients experience only mild symptoms, a relevant proportion develop severe disease progression with increasing hypoxia up to acute respiratory distress syndrome.Registered 03 March 2020,Troponin I, a risk factor indicating more severe pneumonia among patients with novel coronavirus infected pneumoniaBACKGROUND: In December 2019, a novel communicable disease, novel coronavirus infected pneumonia (NCIP) caused by Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) broke out.After adjusting for potential cofounders in separate modes, NT-proBNP presented as an independent risk factor of in-hospital death in patients with severe COVID-19.Level of IL-6 predicts respiratory failure in hospitalized symptomatic COVID-19 patientsThe pandemic Coronavirus-disease 19 (COVID-19) is characterized by a heterogeneous clinical course.Results found that patients with higher NT-proBNP (above 88.64 pg/mL) level had more risks of in-hospital death.CONCLUSION: NT-proBNP might be an independent risk factor for in-hospital death in patients with severe COVID-19.
